intro: Bauhinia gentlei, commonly known as the velvet bauhinia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The bark and leaves of Bauhinia gentlei have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
